TrackAndAnalyzeMeetings: Track and analyze meeting occurrences from your Microsoft 365 calendar. Choose between direct integration or JSON file import.
GraphApiAuthInfo: This mode requires authentication with your Microsoft 365 account. Users from any organization can sign in and consent to read their calendar.
EnterMeetingTitleToSearch: Enter meeting title to search for...
PleaseSignInToSearchCalendar: Please sign in to search your calendar.
UploadJsonInfo: Upload a JSON file generated by your Power Automate flow.
ChooseFromRecurringMeetings: Choose from recurring meetings found in the file
OnlyEventsContainingText: Only events containing this text will be included
ShowingResultsForSubject: Showing results for meetings with subject containing "{0}"
VerifyPaystubInfo: Verify that your paystub data matches the calendar data. You can add multiple verification cards to check different months simultaneously.
PaystubDataMatchesCalendar: Your paystub data matches the calendar entries.
NoCalendarDataAvailable: No calendar data available. Please process a file first.
PleaseWaitAuthentication: Please wait while we authenticate you.
AuthFailedExplanation: We couldn't sign you in. This could be due to:
AzureAdConfigIssues: Microsoft Entra app registration configuration issues
SignOutFailedExplanation: We couldn't complete the sign out process.
FileLoadedWithRecurring: File '{0}' loaded successfully. Found {1} recurring meeting subject(s). Select one and click Process.
FileLoadedEnterSubject: File '{0}' loaded successfully. Enter a subject filter and click Process.
NoEventsFoundMatchingSubject: No events found matching subject '{0}' in the uploaded file.
NoMeetingDaysFoundAfterAnalysis: No meeting days found after analysis.
SuccessfullyAnalyzedEvents: Successfully analyzed {0} events across {1} unique days.
NoEventsFoundInCalendar: No events found matching subject '{0}' in your calendar.
SuccessfullyFoundEvents: Successfully found {0} events across {1} unique days.
ExportM365CalendarToJson: Export your M365 Calendar Meetings to JSON in 8 simple steps
GuideStep1Title: Step 1: Create New Power Automate Flow
GuideStep1_ClickCreate: Click Create then Instant cloud flow
GuideStep1_SelectTrigger: Select trigger: Manually trigger a flow
GuideStep1_Tip: Tip: Make sure you're signed in with your Microsoft 365 work account before starting.
GuideStep2_AddInput: In the manual trigger, click Add an input
GuideStep3_ChooseAction: Choose: Get calendar view of events (V3)
GuideStep4_SearchData: Search for and select Data Operation
GuideStep4_FromField: From: Click in the field and select "value" from the dynamic content
GuideStep4_AdvancedMode: Click Edit in advanced mode and paste:
GuideStep5Title: Step 5: Transform to Required JSON Format
GuideStep5_FromOutput: From: Output from Filter array action
GuideStep5_ClickMap: Click Map and add these fields:
GuideStep5_SwitchToArray: Click "Switch to input entire array" and enter:
GuideStep6_InputsField: In the Inputs field, switch to code view and paste:
GuideStep7_SearchOneDrive: Search for and select OneDrive for Business
GuideStep7_FileContent: File Content: Select "Outputs" from the Compose step
GuideStep7_CreateFolder: Note: Create the folder /Documents/CalendarExports in OneDrive before running the flow.
GuideStep7_SharePointAlt: Alternative: You can use SharePoint instead of OneDrive by selecting "SharePoint" - "Create file" and choosing your site.
GuideStep8_FindFlow: Find your flow and click Run
GuideStep8_EnterSubject: Enter the meeting subject you want to filter (e.g., "Project Standup")
GuideStep8_UploadToApp: Upload it to the Storingsdienst web application
GuideStep8_FlowComplete: Your Power Automate flow is now complete. You can run it anytime to export your calendar meetings to JSON format.
GuideStep8_ReturnToHome: Return to Home & Upload Your JSON
Troubleshoot_Unauthorized1: Ensure you've authorized the Office 365 Outlook and OneDrive connections
Troubleshoot_Unauthorized2: Go to Connections and re-authenticate if needed
Troubleshoot_NoEvents1: Check that your subject filter matches actual meeting titles (case-sensitive!)
Troubleshoot_NoEvents2: Verify meetings exist in the past year
Troubleshoot_NoEvents3: Try a partial match (e.g., "Standup" instead of "Project Standup Meeting")
Troubleshoot_NoFile: JSON file not found in OneDrive
Troubleshoot_NoFile2: Check the flow run history for errors
Troubleshoot_InvalidJson: Invalid JSON error in the app
Troubleshoot_InvalidJson1: Download and open the JSON file in a text editor
Troubleshoot_InvalidJson2: Verify it matches the expected format above
Troubleshoot_InvalidJson3: Check for any error messages in the file
Security_RunsInTenant: The flow runs entirely within your Microsoft 365 tenant
Security_NoExternalData: No data is sent to external services
Security_StoredInOneDrive: JSON files are stored in your personal OneDrive
Security_CanDelete: You can delete JSON files after importing them to the app
AboutDescription: This application is a showcase of modern web development using AI-assisted coding and agentic development workflows. It demonstrates the ability to rapidly build production-ready applications that integrate with enterprise APIs like Microsoft Graph.
ClaudeCodeDesc: Agentic AI coding assistant for autonomous development
GitHubCopilotDesc: AI pair programming for code review and issue management
PlaywrightMCPDesc: Model Context Protocol for automated browser testing
GitHubActionsDesc: CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment
MicrosoftAzureDesc: Cloud hosting with Azure App Service
BlazorDesc: Modern SPA framework with C# and .NET 8
MicrosoftGraphDesc: Enterprise calendar and user data integration
MudBlazorDesc: Material Design component library for Blazor
ContactUs: Contact us to discuss your project
HowWeCanHelp: How We Can Help Your Organization Forward
HowWeCanHelpDescription: We help organizations accelerate their digital transformation through modern development practices and Microsoft 365 integration:
AIAdoptionDesc: We help organizations adopt Claude Code, GitHub Copilot, and modern CI/CD practices to dramatically increase development velocity and code quality.Accelerate your development teams with AI-assisted coding workflows.
M365PortalsDesc: Create unified experiences for your employees and customers. Build tailored web applications that seamlessly integrate with SharePoint, Teams, Outlook, and other Microsoft 365 services.
ProcessAutomationDesc: Streamline repetitive tasks and reduce manual data entry. End-to-end automation solutions combining Power Automate, custom APIs, and web applications.
ViewSourceOnGitHub: View the source code on GitHub
